014package org.microbean.invoke;
015
016import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
017import java.util.Objects;
018import java.util.Optional;
019
020import java.util.function.BiFunction;
021import java.util.function.Consumer;
022import java.util.function.Function;
023import java.util.function.Predicate;
024import java.util.function.Supplier;
025
026import java.util.stream.Stream;
027
028/**
029 * A {@link Supplier} with additional contractual requirements.
030 *
031 * <p><strong>An {@link OptionalSupplier} does not behave like an
032 * {@link Optional} or a {@link
033 * java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture},</strong> despite the
034 * deliberate similarities of some method names.</p>
035 *
036 * <p>An implementation of this interface is not a <a
037 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
038 * class</a>.</p>
039 *
040 * @param <T> the type of value implementations of this interface
041 * {@linkplain #get() supply}
042 *
043 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
044 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
045 *
046 * @see #determinism()
047 *
048 * @see #get()
049 *
050 * @see #optional()
051 */
052@FunctionalInterface
053public interface OptionalSupplier<T> extends Supplier<T> {
054
055  /**
056   * Returns either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
057   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
058   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method
059   * on the supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException}
060   * that does occur, including {@link NoSuchElementException} and
061   * {@link UnsupportedOperationException} instances that are used to
062   * indicate value absence.
063   *
064   * @param handler the exception handler; must not be {@code null}
065   *
066   * @return either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
067   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
068   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method
069   * on the supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException}
070   * that does occur
071   *
072   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
073   * null}
074   *
075   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
076   * return {@code null}
077   *
078   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
079   * determinism.
080   *
081   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its (discouraged)
082   * overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads,
083   * but the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method of
084   * the supplied {@code handler} may not be.
085   *
086   * @see #get()
087   */
088  public default T exceptionally(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
089    try {
090      return this.get();
091    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
092      try {
093        return handler.apply(e);
094      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
095        r.addSuppressed(e);
096        throw r;
097      }
098    }
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Returns a value, which may be {@code null}.
103   *
104   * <p>This method's contract extends {@link Supplier#get()}'s
105   * contract with the following additional requirements:</p>
106   *
107   * <ul>
108   *
109   * <li><strong>It is deliberately and explicitly permitted for
110   * implementations of this method to return {@code null} for any
111   * reason.</strong> Callers of this method must be appropriately
112   * prepared.</li>
113   *
114   * <li>If an invocation of the {@link #determinism()} method, on any
115   * thread, returns any of {@link Determinism#ABSENT}, {@link
116   * Determinism#DETERMINISTIC} or {@link Determinism#PRESENT}, then
117   * additional requirements apply to the implementation of this
118   * method; see the {@link #determinism()} method documentation for
119   * details.</li>
120   *
121   * <li>An implementation of this method need not be deterministic if
122   * an invocation of the {@link #determinism()} method returns {@link
123   * Determinism#NON_DETERMINISTIC}.</li>
124   *
125   * <li>An implementation of this method may indicate the (possibly
126   * transitory) absence of a value by any of the following means:
127   *
128   * <ul>
129   *
130   * <li>Throwing a {@link NoSuchElementException}.</li>
131   *
132   * <li>Throwing an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.</li>
133   *
134   * </ul></li>
135   *
136   * </ul>
137   *
138   * @return a value, which may be {@code null}
139   *
140   * @exception NoSuchElementException to indicate (usually
141   * transitory) absence
142   *
143   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException to indicate (usually
144   * permanent) absence
145   *
146   * @nullability Implementations of this method may, and often will,
147   * return {@code null}, even in the normal course of events.
148   *
149   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
150   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
151   *
152   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
153   * determinism.  An ideal implementation should be idempotent.  If
154   * the {@link #determinism() determinism()} method returns a {@link
155   * Determinism} that is not {@link Determinism#NON_DETERMINISTIC}, then any
156   * implementation of this method must be deterministic.
157   *
158   * @see #determinism()
159   */
160  @Override
161  public T get();
162
163  /**
164   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link
165   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object) apply(Object, Object)} method on
166   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplying it with the result of an
167   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
168   * null}, or any {@link RuntimeException} that an invocation of the
169   * {@link #get()} method throws, including {@link
170   * NoSuchElementException} and {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
171   * instances that are used to indicate value absence.
172   *
173   * <p>The first argument to the handler will be the return value of
174   * the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code null}.  The second
175   * argument to the handler will be any {@link RuntimeException} that
176   * was thrown during the invocation of the {@link #get()} method,
177   * including {@link NoSuchElementException} and {@link
178   * UnsupportedOperationException} instances that are used to
179   * indicate value absence.</p>
180   *
181   * @param <U> the type of the value returned
182   *
183   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
184   *
185   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
186   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object) apply(Object, Object)} method on
187   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplying it with the result of an
188   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
189   * null}, or any {@link RuntimeException} that an invocation of the
190   * {@link #get()} method throws, including {@link
191   * NoSuchElementException} and {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
192   * instances that are used to indicate value absence
193   *
194   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
195   * null}
196   *
197   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
198   * return {@code null}.
199   *
200   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
201   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
202   *
203   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
204   * determinism.
205   *
206   * @see #get()
207   */
208  public default <U> U handle(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
209    T value;
210    try {
211      value = this.get();
212    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
213      try {
214        return handler.apply(null, e);
215      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
216        r.addSuppressed(e);
217        throw r;
218      }
219    }
220    return handler.apply(value, null);
221  }
222
223  /**
224   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object) accept(Object)} method
225   * on the supplied {@code action} with the return value of an
226   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
227   * null}, unless the {@link #get()} method throws either a {@link
228   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
229   * UnsupportedOperationException}, indicating value absence, in
230   * which case no action is taken.
231   *
232   * @param action the {@link Consumer} representing the action to
233   * take; must not be {@code null}
234   *
235   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} is {@code null}
236   *
237   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
238   * determinism.
239   *
240   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
241   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
242   * supplied {@link Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)
243   * accept(Object)} method may not be
244   *
245   * @see #get()
246   */
247  public default void ifPresent(final Consumer<? super T> action) {
248    T value;
249    try {
250      value = this.get();
251    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
252      return;
253    }
254    action.accept(value);
255  }
256
257  /**
258   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object) accept(Object)} method
259   * on the supplied {@code presentAction} with the return value of an
260   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
261   * null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates value absence
262   * by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
263   * UnsupportedOperationException}, invokes the {@link Runnable#run()
264   * run()} method of the supplied {@code absentAction} instead.
265   *
266   * @param presentAction the {@link Consumer} representing the action
267   * to take if a value is present; must not be {@code null}
268   *
269   * @param absentAction the {@link Runnable} representing the action
270   * to take if a value is absent; must not be {@code null}
271   *
272   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} or {@code
273   * absentAction} is {@code null}
274   *
275   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
276   * determinism.
277   *
278   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
279   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
280   * supplied {@link Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)
281   * accept(Object)} method may not be and the supplied {@link
282   * Runnable}'s {@link Runnable#run() run()} method may not be
283   *
284   * @see #get()
285   */
286  public default void ifPresentOrElse(final Consumer<? super T> presentAction, final Runnable absentAction) {
287    T value;
288    try {
289      value = this.get();
290    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
291      try {
292        absentAction.run();
293        return;
294      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
295        r.addSuppressed(e);
296        throw r;
297      }
298    }
299    presentAction.accept(value);
300  }
301
302  /**
303   * Returns a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
304   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
305   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}.
306   *
307   * <p>The default implementation of this method does not and its
308   * overrides must not return {@code null}.</p>
309   *
310   * <p>The default implementation of this method catches all {@link
311   * NoSuchElementException}s and {@link
312   * UnsupportedOperationException}s and returns an empty {@link
313   * Optional} in these cases, which may not be valid for some use
314   * cases.  To detect permanent versus transitory absence, potential
315   * callers should use the {@link #get()} method directly or either
316   * the {@link #optional(Function)} or {@link #optional(BiFunction)}
317   * methods.</p>
318   *
319   * @return a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
320   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
321   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}
322   *
323   * @nullability The default implementation of this method does not,
324   * and its (discouraged) overrides must not, return {@code null}.
325   *
326   * @threadsafety The default implementation of this method is, and
327   * its (discouraged) overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by
328   * multiple threads.
329   *
330   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
331   * determinism.
332   *
333   * @see #optional(BiFunction)
334   *
335   * @see #get()
336   */
337  public default Optional<T> optional() {
338    return this.optional(OptionalSupplier::returnNull);
339  }
340
341  /**
342   * Invokes the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method, supplying it with
343   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to the
344   * {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
345   * result.
346   *
347   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link Optional}
348   *
349   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
350   *
351   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
352   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
353   * value of invoking the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method with the
354   * supplied {@code handler}
355   *
356   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
357   * null}
358   *
359   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
360   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
361   *
362   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
363   * determinism.
364   *
365   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
366   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
367   *
368   * @see #handle(BiFunction)
369   *
370   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
371   */
372  public default <U> Optional<U> optional(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
373    return Optional.ofNullable(this.handle(handler));
374  }
375
376  /**
377   * Invokes the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method, supplying it
378   * with the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to
379   * the {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
380   * result.
381   *
382   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
383   *
384   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
385   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
386   * value of invoking the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method
387   * with the supplied {@code handler}
388   *
389   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
390   * null}
391   *
392   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
393   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
394   *
395   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
396   * determinism.
397   *
398   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
399   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
400   *
401   * @see #exceptionally(Function)
402   *
403   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
404   */
405  public default Optional<T> optional(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
406    return Optional.ofNullable(this.exceptionally(handler));
407  }
408
409  /**
410   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
411   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
412   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
413   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the supplied
414   * alternate value, which may be {@code null}.
415   *
416   * @param other the alternate value; may be {@code null}
417   *
418   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
419   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
420   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
421   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the supplied
422   * alternate value, which may be {@code null}
423   *
424   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
425   * return {@code null}.
426   *
427   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
428   * determinism.
429   *
430   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
431   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
432   *
433   * @see #get()
434   */
435  public default T orElse(final T other) {
436    try {
437      return this.get();
438    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
439      return other;
440    }
441  }
442
443  /**
444   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
445   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
446   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
447   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result
448   * of invoking the {@link #get()} method on the supplied {@link
449   * Supplier}, which may be {@code null}.
450   *
451   * @param supplier the alternate value {@link Supplier}; must not be
452   * {@code null}
453   *
454   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
455   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
456   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
457   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result
458   * of invoking the {@link #get()} method on the supplied {@link
459   * Supplier}, which may be {@code null}
460   *
461   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
462   * null}
463   *
464   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
465   * return {@code null}.
466   *
467   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
468   * determinism.
469   *
470   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
471   * msut be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
472   * {@link Supplier#get() get()} method of the supplied {@code supplier}
473   * may not be
474   *
475   * @see #get()
476   */
477  public default T orElseGet(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
478    try {
479      return this.get();
480    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
481      try {
482        return supplier.get();
483      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
484        r.addSuppressed(e);
485        throw r;
486      }
487    }
488  }
489
490  /**
491   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
492   * may be {@code null}.
493   *
494   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
495   * may be {@code null}
496   *
497   * @exception NoSuchElementException if value absence was indicated
498   * by the {@link #get()} method
499   *
500   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
501   * return {@code null}.
502   *
503   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
504   * determinism.
505   *
506   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
507   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
508   *
509   * @see #orElseThrow(Supplier)
510   */
511  public default T orElseThrow() {
512    try {
513      return this.get();
514    } catch (final UnsupportedOperationException e) {
515      throw new NoSuchElementException(e.getMessage(), e);
516    }
517  }
518
519  /**
520   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
521   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
522   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
523   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, throws the return
524   * value of an invocation of the supplied {@link Supplier}'s {@link
525   * Supplier#get() get()} method.
526   *
527   * @param <X> the type of {@link Throwable} the supplied {@code
528   * throwableSupplier} {@linkplain Supplier#get() supplies}
529   *
530   * @param throwableSupplier the {@link Throwable} {@link Supplier};
531   * must not be {@code null}
532   *
533   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
534   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
535   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
536   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, throws the return
537   * value of an invocation of the supplied {@link Supplier}'s {@link
538   * Supplier#get() get()} method
539   *
540   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
541   * null}
542   *
543   * @exception X (actually {@code <X>}) if the {@link #get()} method
544   * throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
545   * UnsupportedOperationException}
546   *
547   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
548   * return {@code null}.
549   *
550   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
551   * determinism.
552   *
553   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its (discouraged)
554   * overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
555   *
556   * @see #get()
557   */
558  public default <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow(final Supplier<? extends X> throwableSupplier) throws X {
559    try {
560      return this.get();
561    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
562      final X throwable = throwableSupplier.get();
563      if (throwable.getCause() == null) {
564        throwable.initCause(e);
565      } else {
566        throwable.addSuppressed(e);
567      }
568      throw throwable;
569    }
570  }
571
572  /**
573   * Returns an {@link Determinism} denoting the presence of values
574   * returned by this {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@link #get() get()}
575   * method.
576   *
577   * <p>Overrides of this method must be compatible with the
578   * implementation of the {@link #get()} method.  Specifically:</p>
579   *
580   * <ul>
581   *
582   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
583   * Determinism#PRESENT}, then the implementation of the {@link #get()}
584   * method must never throw either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
585   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, and, for any two
586   * invocations, on any thread, must return either the same object, or
587   * objects that are indistinguishable from one another and that can
588   * be substituted for each other interchangeably.</li>
589   *
590   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
591   * Determinism#ABSENT}, then it is expected that any two invocations of
592   * the {@link #get()} method, on any thread, will each throw either
593   * a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
594   * UnsupportedOperationException}.  If an implementation of the
595   * {@link #get()} method instead returns a value, contrary to these
596   * requirements, then the value must be treated as irrelevant or
597   * undefined.</li>
598   *
599   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
600   * Determinism#DETERMINISTIC}, then any two invocations of the {@link
601   * #get()} method implementation, on any thread, must either throw
602   * either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
603   * UnsupportedOperationException}, or must return either the same
604   * object, or objects that are indistinguishable from one another
605   * and that can be substituted for each other interchangeably.</li>
606   *
607   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
608   * Determinism#NON_DETERMINISTIC}, then there are no additional requirements
609   * placed upon the implementation of the {@link #get()} method
610   * besides those defined in {@linkplain #get() its existing
611   * contract}.</li>
612   *
613   * </ul>
614   *
615   * <p>Additionally, once an override of this method returns a {@link
616   * Determinism} whose {@link Determinism#deterministic() deterministic()}
617   * method returns {@code true}, then it must forever afterwards, for
618   * all invocations, on all possible threads, return the same {@link
619   * Determinism}.</p>
620   *
621   * <p>If any of the requirements above is not met, undefined
622   * behavior may result.</p>
623   *
624   * <p>The default implementation of this method returns {@link
625   * Determinism#NON_DETERMINISTIC}.  Overrides are strongly encouraged.</p>
626   *
627   * @return an {@link Determinism} denoting the presence of values
628   * returned by this {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@link #get() get()}
629   * method
630   *
631   * @nullability This method does not, and its (encouraged) overrides
632   * must not, return {@code null}.
633   *
634   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.  Its
635   * (encouraged) overrides must be idempotent.  They may not be
636   * deterministic (see above).
637   *
638   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (encouraged) overrides must
639   * be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
640   */
641  public default Determinism determinism() {
642    return Determinism.NON_DETERMINISTIC;
643  }
644
645  /**
646   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link Stream#of(Object)}
647   * method on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #get()}
648   * method, which may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()}
649   * method indicates value absence by throwing either a {@link
650   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
651   * UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result of invoking
652   * the {@link Stream#empty()} method.
653   *
654   * <p>Note that this means the sole element of the {@link Stream}
655   * that is returned may be {@code null}.  If this is undesirable,
656   * consider invoking {@link Optional#stream() stream()} on the
657   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method instead.</p>
658   *
659   * @return the result of invoking the {@link Stream#of(Object)}
660   * method on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #get()}
661   * method, which may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()}
662   * method indicates value absence by throwing either a {@link
663   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
664   * UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result of invoking
665   * the {@link Stream#empty()} method
666   *
667   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
668   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
669   *
670   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
671   * determinism.
672   *
673   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
674   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
675   *
676   * @see #get()
677   */
678  public default Stream<T> stream() {
679    try {
680      return Stream.of(this.get());
681    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
682      return Stream.empty();
683    }
684  }
685
686
687  /*
688   * Static methods.
689   */
690
691
692  private static <T> T returnNull(final RuntimeException e) {
693    if (e instanceof NoSuchElementException || e instanceof UnsupportedOperationException) {
694      return null;
695    } else {
696      throw e;
697    }
698  }
699
700  /**
701   * Returns a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #determinism()}
702   * method will return the supplied {@link Determinism} and whose {@link
703   * #get()} method will return the result of invoking the {@link
704   * Supplier#get()} method on the supplied {@code supplier}.
705   *
706   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
707   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
708   *
709   * @param determinism the {@link Determinism} to use; must not be {@code null}
710   *
711   * @param supplier the {@link Supplier} whose {@link #get()} method
712   * will be called; must not be {@code null}
713   *
714   * @return a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #determinism()}
715   * method will return the supplied {@link Determinism} and whose {@link
716   * #get()} method will return the result of invoking the {@link
717   * Supplier#get()} method on the supplied {@code supplier}
718   *
719   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code determinism} or {@code
720   * supplier} is {@code null}
721   *
722   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
723   *
724   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
725   *
726   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
727   * threads.
728   */
729  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final Determinism determinism, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
730    return new OptionalSupplierAdapter<>(determinism, supplier);
731  }
732
733  /**
734   * Invokes {@link Absence#instance()} and returns the result.
735   *
736   * @param <T> the type of the nonexistent value the returned {@link
737   * OptionalSupplier} will never {@linkplain #get() supply}
738   *
739   * @return the result of invoking {@link Absence#instance()}
740   *
741   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
742   *
743   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
744   *
745   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
746   * multiple threads.
747   *
748   * @see Absence#instance()
749   */
750  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of() {
751    return Absence.instance();
752  }
753
754  /**
755   * Returns an {@link OptionalSupplier} representing the supplied
756   * {@link Supplier}.
757   *
758   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
759   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
760   *
761   * @param supplier the {@link Supplier}; may be {@code null} in
762   * which case the return value of an invocation of {@link
763   * Absence#instance()} will be returned
764   *
765   * @return an {@link OptionalSupplier} representing the supplied
766   * {@link Supplier}
767   *
768   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
769   *
770   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
771   *
772   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
773   * multiple threads.
774   */
775  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
776  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
777    if (supplier == null) {
778      return Absence.instance();
779    } else if (supplier instanceof OptionalSupplier<? extends T> os) {
780      return (OptionalSupplier<T>)os;
781    } else {
782      return new OptionalSupplierAdapter<>(supplier);
783    }
784  }
785
786  /**
787   * Returns an {@link OptionalSupplier} that will, loosely speaking,
788   * try the supplied {@code supplier} first, and, if it throws a
789   * {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
790   * UnsupportedOperationException} from its {@link Supplier#get()}
791   * method, will then try the supplied {@code defaults}.
792   *
793   * <p>The supplied {@link Supplier} instances can, themselves, be
794   * {@link OptionalSupplier}s, and, if so, the resulting {@link
795   * OptionalSupplier} will have its {@link #determinism()} method
796   * appropriately implemented.</p>
797   *
798   * @param <T> the type of object the returned {@link
799   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
800   *
801   * @param supplier the first {@link Supplier} to try; may be {@code
802   * null}
803   *
804   * @param defaults the fallback {@link Supplier} to try; may be
805   * {@code null}
806   *
807   * @return a {@link DefaultingOptionalSupplier}
808   *
809   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
810   *
811   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
812   *
813   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
814   * threads.
815   */
816  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier, final Supplier<? extends T> defaults) {
817    if (supplier == null) {
818      if (defaults == null) {
819        return Absence.instance();
820      } else {
821        return of(defaults);
822      }
823    } else if (defaults == null) {
824      return of(supplier);
825    } else {
826      return DefaultingOptionalSupplier.of(supplier, defaults);
827    }
828  }
829
830  /**
831   * Returns a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #determinism()}
832   * method will return {@link Determinism#PRESENT} and whose {@link
833   * #get()} method will return the supplied {@code value}.
834   *
835   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
836   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
837   *
838   * @param value the value the new {@link OptionalSupplier} will
839   * return from its {@link #get()} method; may be {@code null}
840   *
841   * @return a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #determinism()}
842   * method will return {@link Determinism#PRESENT} and whose {@link
843   * #get()} method will return the supplied {@code value}
844   *
845   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
846   *
847   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
848   *
849   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
850   * threads.
851   */
852  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final T value) {
853    return FixedValueSupplier.of(value);
854  }
855
856
857  /*
858   * Inner and nested classes.
859   */
860
861
862  /**
863   * A token indicating transitory or permanent presence or absence.
864   *
865   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
866   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
867   *
868   * @see #deterministic()
869   *
870   * @see OptionalSupplier#determinism()
871   */
872  public static enum Determinism {
873
874    /**
875     * An {@link Determinism} indicating an unknown, possibly
876     * transitory, determinism or absence.
877     */
878    NON_DETERMINISTIC(false),
879
880    /**
881     * An {@link Determinism} indicating an unknown permanent presence
882     * or absence.
883     */
884    DETERMINISTIC(true),
885
886    /**
887     * An {@link Determinism} indicating permanent absence.
888     */
889    ABSENT(true),
890
891    /**
892     * An {@link Determinism} indicating permanent determinism.
893     */
894    PRESENT(true);
895
896    private final boolean deterministic;
897
898    private Determinism(final boolean deterministic) {
899      this.deterministic = deterministic;
900    }
901
902    /**
903     * Returns {@code true} if the presence or absence denoted by this
904     * {@link Determinism} is deterministic.
905     *
906     * @return {@code true} if the presence or absence denoted by this
907     * {@link Determinism} is deterministic
908     *
909     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
910     *
911     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
912     * multiple threads.
913     */
914    public final boolean deterministic() {
915      return this.deterministic;
916    }
917
918  }
919
920}
